page.title: 02Shipham Village.
page.content: In 1790 Shipham had 73 buildings housing 380 inhabitants, nearly all miners "in the street, in the yards and some in the very houses." In 1980 Shipham had 400 houses and 1046 inhabitants. In recent years Shipham has become a place of residence for more and more people who work in Bristol and Weston. New houses have been built in several roads and a four bedroomed house with a garden costs around Â£70,000. However the village retains some old mining characteristics. An irregular network of narrow lanes wind through a number of sternly grey cottages. Its Church, St.Leonard's, is a Victorian building with an octagonal tower and a partly carpetted interior. Its present font cover was made from the massive oak door to the original Church, which was pulled down in 1840.
